main event: A bright flaming orange object similar in shape to an egg with a tail was observed near Peace River, Alberta Province, some 250 miles NW of Edmonton, by 1st Lt James Toomey & S/Sgt Onno C. Blink, Radio Operator, while on the first leg of the flight from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, to Kittigazuit, N.W. T's. The object was momentarily sighted at zero degrees; broken stratus clouds. The object, very flaming at 1,700 ft MSL on top of an overcast when the object was sighted.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright flaming orange object similar in shape to an egg with a tail.
The sighting occurred on the first leg of a flight from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, to Kittigazuit, N.W.T.
The object appeared at an altitude of approximately 15,000 feet and was judged to be in a shallow dive, emitting no sound.
The object momentarily illuminated the sky behind it as it passed, and it was observed to be on a southwest heading at an unknown speed.
The weather at the time was described as overcast with tops at approximately 4500' MSL with a high deck of thin broken stratus clouds at approximately 12,000 ft.
sighted object: bright flaming orange object similar in shape to an egg with a tail
witnesses: 1st Lt James Toomey & S/Sgt Onno C. Blink, Radio Operator
